工程概率统计 学习笔记

发表于2026-01-04|更新于2026-01-04|SUSTech
|字数总计:10.4k|阅读时长:61分钟|阅读量:

Chapter 1. Basis

Basic Concepts

Random Experiment (随机试验)

Sample Point ω\omegaω (样本点): Each possible fundamental outcome.

Sample Space Ω\OmegaΩ​ (样本空间): A set that includes all sample points.

Random Event (随机事件): A subset of Ω\OmegaΩ.

Inclusion: A⊂BA \subset BA⊂B.

Sum / Union: A∪BA \cup BA∪B, A+BA + BA+B.

Product / Intersection: A∩BA \cap BA∩B, ABABAB.

Difference: A−BA - BA−B, A∖BA \setminus BA∖B.

Mutually Exclusive / Disjoint (互斥): A∩B=∅A \cap B = \varnothingA∩B=∅.

Complement (对立, 互补): A∩B=∅∧A∪B=ΩA \cap B = \varnothing \land A \cup B = \OmegaA∩B=∅∧A∪B=Ω. Denoted as B=Ac=A‾B = A^c = \overline{A}B=Ac=A.

De Morgan’s Laws: ⋃i=1∞Ai‾=⋂i=1∞Ai‾\overline{\bigcup_{i = 1}^{\infty} A_i} = \bigcap_{i = 1}^{\infty} \overline{A_i}⋃i=1∞​Ai​​=⋂i=1∞​Ai​​, ⋂i=1∞Ai‾=⋃i=1∞Ai‾\overline{\bigcap_{i = 1}^{\infty} A_i} = \bigcup_{i = 1}^{\infty} \overline{A_i}⋂i=1∞​Ai​​=⋃i=1∞​Ai​​.

Probability (Measure) (概率(测度)): a real-valued function defined on subsets of Ω\OmegaΩ that satisfies:

  • Non-negativity: A⊆ΩA \subseteq \OmegaA⊆Ω, P(A)≥0P(A) \ge 0P(A)≥0​.
  • Normalization: P(Ω)=1P(\Omega) = 1P(Ω)=1.
  • Additivity: P(⋃i=1∞Ai)=∑i=1∞P(Ai)P\left(\bigcup_{i = 1}^{\infty} A_i\right) = \sum_{i = 1}^{\infty} P\left(A_i\right)P(⋃i=1∞​Ai​)=∑i=1∞​P(Ai​).

Properties of Probability:

  • P(∅)=0P(\varnothing) = 0P(∅)=0​.
  • Finite Additivity: P(⋃i=1nAi)=∑i=1nP(Ai)P\left(\bigcup_{i = 1}^n A_i\right) = \sum_{i = 1}^n P\left(A_i\right)P(⋃i=1n​Ai​)=∑i=1n​P(Ai​)​.
  • The Complement Rule: P(A‾)=1−P(A)P(\overline{A}) = 1 - P(A)P(A)=1−P(A).
  • The numeric bound: 0≤P(A)≤10 \le P(A) \le 10≤P(A)≤1.
  • Monotonicity: if A⊆BA \subseteq BA⊆B, then P(A)≤P(B)P(A) \le P(B)P(A)≤P(B) and P(B−A)=P(B)−P(A)P(B - A) = P(B) - P(A)P(B−A)=P(B)−P(A).
  • The Addition Law: P(A∪B)=P(A)+P(B)−P(AB)P(A \cup B) = P(A) + P(B) - P(AB)P(A∪B)=P(A)+P(B)−P(AB).
  • The Inclusion-exclusion Principle (容斥原理)

Computing Probabilities

Classical Model of Probability (古典概型): each sample point is equally likely to occur. P(A)=knP(A) = \frac{k}{n}P(A)=nk​.

Geometric Model of Probability (几何概型)

Conditional Probability & Independence

Conditional Probability: P(A∣B)=P(AB)P(B)P(A | B) = \frac{P(AB)}{P(B)}P(A∣B)=P(B)P(AB)​.

Multiplication Law: P(AB)=P(A∣B)P(B)P(AB) = P(A | B) P(B)P(AB)=P(A∣B)P(B).

Law of Total Probability: For a partition (分划) B1,B2,⋯ ,BnB_1, B_2, \cdots, B_nB1​,B2​,⋯,Bn​, P(A)=∑P(A∣Bi)P(Bi)P(A) = \sum P(A | B_i) P(B_i)P(A)=∑P(A∣Bi​)P(Bi​).

Bayes’ Theorem / Bayes’ Rule: P(Bi∣A)=P(Bi)P(A∣Bi)P(A)=P(Bi)P(A∣Bi)∑P(Bj)P(A∣Bj)P(B_i | A) = \frac{P(B_i) P(A | B_i)}{P(A)} = \frac{P(B_i) P(A | B_i)}{\sum P(B_j) P(A | B_j)}P(Bi​∣A)=P(A)P(Bi​)P(A∣Bi​)​=∑P(Bj​)P(A∣Bj​)P(Bi​)P(A∣Bi​)​​.

  • Posterior Probaility (后验概率): P(Bi∣A)P(B_i | A)P(Bi​∣A) (of BiB_iBi​).
  • Prior Probability / Marginal Probability (边缘概率): P(Bi)P(B_i)P(Bi​) (of BiB_iBi​).

Independence: If P(AB)=P(A)P(B)P(AB) = P(A) P(B)P(AB)=P(A)P(B), then AAA and BBB​ are independent.

Mutually Exclusive: If P(AB)=0P(AB) = 0P(AB)=0, then AAA and BBB are mutually exclusive.

Chapter 2. Random Variables and Distributions

Random Variables

Definition:

  • is a real-valued function defined on the sample space, typically denoted by capital letters like X,Y,ZX, Y, ZX,Y,Z.

Discrete Random Variable (离散型随机变量):

  • 取有限或可数的值。使用 Probability Mass Function (PMF, 概率质量函数) 描述：

    p(ai)=pi=P(X=ai)p(a_i) = p_i = P(X = a_i) p(ai​)=pi​=P(X=ai​)

    满足 p(ai)≥0p(a_i) \ge 0p(ai​)≥0（Non-negativity），∑p(ai)=1\sum p(a_i) = 1∑p(ai​)=1​（Normalization）。

Continuous Random Variable (连续型随机变量):

  • 取连续、不可数的值。使用 Probability Density Function (PDF, 概率密度函数) 描述。

    P(a≤X≤b)=∫x=abf(x)dxP(a \le X \le b) = \int_{x = a}^b f(x) \mathrm{d}x P(a≤X≤b)=∫x=ab​f(x)dx

    满足 f(x)≥0f(x) \ge 0f(x)≥0（Non-negativity），∫−∞∞f(x)dx=1\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(x) \mathrm{d}x = 1∫−∞∞​f(x)dx=1​（Normalization）。

二者都可以用 Cumulative Distribution Function (CDF, 累积分布函数) 描述：

  • F(x)=P(X≤x),∀x∈RF(x) = P(X \le x), \quad \forall x \in \R F(x)=P(X≤x),∀x∈R

    对于离散型随机变量，CDF 是阶梯函数；对于连续型随机变量，CDF 是连续函数。

Expectation (期望):

  • 对于离散型随机变量：（前提：∑k=1∞xkpk<∞\sum_{k = 1}^{\infty}x_k p_k < \infty∑k=1∞​xk​pk​<∞）

    E(X)≜∑x=1∞xkpkE(X) \triangleq \sum_{x = 1}^{\infty} x_k p_k E(X)≜x=1∑∞​xk​pk​

    对于连续型随机变量：（前提：∫−∞∞∣x∣f(x)dx<∞\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}|x|f(x)\mathrm{d}x < \infty∫−∞∞​∣x∣f(x)dx<∞）

    E(X)≜∫−∞∞xf(x)dxE(X) \triangleq \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x f(x) \mathrm{d}x E(X)≜∫−∞∞​xf(x)dx

Variance (方差):

  • Describes the stability (稳定性) / variability (波动性) of a random variable around its expectation.

  • If E(X2)<∞E\left(X^2\right) < \inftyE(X2)<∞, then

    Var(X)≜E(X−E(X))2\text{Var}(X) \triangleq E\left(X - E(X)\right)^2 Var(X)≜E(X−E(X))2

    and Standard Deviation (SD, 标准差) is defined as

    SD(X)≜Var(X)\text{SD}(X) \triangleq \sqrt{\text{Var}(X)} SD(X)≜Var(X)​

  • Properties:

    • E(aX+b)=aE(X)+bE(aX + b) = aE(X) + bE(aX+b)=aE(X)+b.
    • Var(aX+b)=a2Var(x)\text{Var}(aX + b) = a^2 \text{Var}(x)Var(aX+b)=a2Var(x), SD(aX+b)=aSD(X)\text{SD}(aX + b) = a \text{SD}(X)SD(aX+b)=aSD(X).
    • Var(X)=E(X2)−[E(X)]2\text{Var}(X) = E\left(X^2\right) - [E(X)]^2Var(X)=E(X2)−[E(X)]2​.
    • E[g1(X)±g2(X)]=E[g1(X)]±E[g2(X)]E[g_1(X) \pm g_2(X)] = E[g_1(X)] \pm E[g_2(X)]E[g1​(X)±g2​(X)]=E[g1​(X)]±E[g2​(X)].

Discrete Distributionsss

Bernoulli Distribution (伯努利分布): (抽一次奖)

p(x)=px(1−p)1−x,x=0,1p(x) = p^x (1 - p)^{1 - x}, \quad x = 0, 1 p(x)=px(1−p)1−x,x=0,1

E(X)=p,Var(X)=p(1−p)E(X) = p, \quad \text{Var}(X) = p(1 - p) E(X)=p,Var(X)=p(1−p)

Binomial Distribution (二项分布): (抽 nnn 次奖)

X∼Binomial(n,p)/Bin(n,p)/B(n,p)X \sim \text{Binomial}(n, p) / \text{Bin}(n, p) / B(n, p) X∼Binomial(n,p)/Bin(n,p)/B(n,p)

p(x)=(nx)px(1−p)n−x,x=0,1,2,⋯ ,np(x) = \binom{n}{x} p^x (1 - p)^{n - x}, \quad x = 0, 1, 2, \cdots, n p(x)=(xn​)px(1−p)n−x,x=0,1,2,⋯,n

E(X)=np,Var(X)=np(1−p)E(X) = np, \quad \text{Var}(X) = np(1 - p) E(X)=np,Var(X)=np(1−p)

Geometric Distribution (几何分布): (抽奖直到第 xxx 次中)

X∼Geometric(p)X \sim \text{Geometric}(p) X∼Geometric(p)

p(x)=p(1−p)x−1,x=1,2,⋯p(x) = p(1 - p)^{x - 1}, \quad x = 1, 2, \cdots p(x)=p(1−p)x−1,x=1,2,⋯

E(X)=1p,Var(X)=1−pp2E(X) = \frac{1}{p}, \quad \text{Var}(X) = \frac{1 - p}{p^2} E(X)=p1​,Var(X)=p21−p​

  • 独有性质：Memoryless Property (无记忆性): P(X>m+n∣X>m)=P(X>n)P(X > m + n \mid X > m) = P(X > n)P(X>m+n∣X>m)=P(X>n)​.

Poisson Distribution (泊松分布): (单位时间发生率为 λ\lambdaλ，发生 xxx 次的概率)

X∼Poisson(λ)X \sim \text{Poisson}(\lambda) X∼Poisson(λ)

p(x)=λxx!e−λ,x=0,1,2,⋯p(x) = \frac{\lambda^x}{x!} e^{-\lambda}, \quad x = 0, 1, 2, \cdots p(x)=x!λx​e−λ,x=0,1,2,⋯

E(X)=λ,Var(X)=λE(X) = \lambda, \quad \text{Var}(X) = \lambda E(X)=λ,Var(X)=λ

  • where the parameter λ\lambdaλ​ is called the intensity (泊松强度).
  • The Poisson distribution can be derived as a limiting case of the binomial distribution.

Continuous Distributions

Uniform Distribution (均匀分布):

X∼Uniform(a,b)/X∼U(a,b)X \sim \text{Uniform}(a, b) / X\sim U(a, b) X∼Uniform(a,b)/X∼U(a,b)

f(x)={1b−a,a<x<b0,otherwisef(x) = \begin{cases} \frac{1}{b - a}, & a < x < b \\ 0, & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} f(x)={b−a1​,0,​a<x<botherwise​

P(X≤x)={0,x≤ax−ab−a,a<x<b1,x≥bP(X \le x) = \begin{cases} 0, & x \le a \\ \frac{x - a}{b - a}, & a < x < b \\ 1, & x \ge b \end{cases} P(X≤x)=⎩⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎧​0,b−ax−a​,1,​x≤aa<x<bx≥b​

Exponential Distribution (指数分布):

X∼Exp(λ)X \sim \text{Exp}(\lambda) X∼Exp(λ)

f(x)={λe−λx,x≥00,otherwisef(x) = \begin{cases} \lambda e^{-\lambda x}, & x \ge 0 \\ 0, & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} f(x)={λe−λx,0,​x≥0otherwise​

P(X≤x)={1−e−λx,x≥00,otherwiseP(X \le x) = \begin{cases} 1 - e^{-\lambda x}, & x \ge 0 \\ 0, & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} P(X≤x)={1−e−λx,0,​x≥0otherwise​

E(X)=1λ,Var(X)=1λ2E(X) = \frac{1}{\lambda}, \quad \text{Var}(X) = \frac{1}{\lambda^2} E(X)=λ1​,Var(X)=λ21​

  • Memoryless Property (无记忆性): P(X>m+n∣X>m)=P(X>n)P(X > m + n \mid X > m) = P(X > n)P(X>m+n∣X>m)=P(X>n)​​.
  • 泊松过程（Poisson Process）可以简单理解为随机事件沿时间轴独立且速率恒定发生的过程。指数分布可以用来描述泊松过程中事件之间时间间隔的分布。

Normal Distribution (正态分布) / Gaussian Distribution (高斯分布):

X∼N(μ,σ2)X \sim N\left(\mu, \sigma^2\right) X∼N(μ,σ2)

f(x)=12πσe−(x−μ)22σ2,x∈Rf(x) = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma} e^{-\frac{(x - \mu)^2}{2 \sigma^2}}, \quad x \in \R f(x)=2π​σ1​e−2σ2(x−μ)2​,x∈R

E(X)=μ,Var(X)=σ2E(X) = \mu, \quad \text{Var}(X) = \sigma^2 E(X)=μ,Var(X)=σ2

  • N(0,1)N(0, 1)N(0,1) is called Standard Normal Distribution (标准正态分布), whose CDF is:

    Φ(x)=P(X≤x)=∫−∞x12πe−t22σ2dt,x∈R\Phi(x) = P(X \le x) = \int_{-\infty}^{x} \frac{1}{\sqrt{2 \pi}} e^{-\frac{t^2}{2 \sigma^2}} \mathrm{d}t, \quad x \in \R Φ(x)=P(X≤x)=∫−∞x​2π​1​e−2σ2t2​dt,x∈R

    If X∼N(μ,σ2)X \sim N(\mu, \sigma^2)X∼N(μ,σ2) and Z=(X−μ)/σZ = (X - \mu) / \sigmaZ=(X−μ)/σ, then Z∼N(0,1)Z \sim N(0, 1)Z∼N(0,1). So:

    P(X≤x)=P(X−μσ≤x−μσ)=P(Z≤x−μσ)=Φ(x−μσ)P(X \le x) = P\left(\frac{X - \mu}{\sigma} \le \frac{x - \mu}{\sigma}\right) = P\left(Z \le \frac{x - \mu}{\sigma}\right) = \Phi\left(\frac{x - \mu}{\sigma}\right) P(X≤x)=P(σX−μ​≤σx−μ​)=P(Z≤σx−μ​)=Φ(σx−μ​)

    By symmetry of PDF:

    Φ(x)+Φ(−x)=1,x∈R\Phi(x) + \Phi(-x) = 1, \quad x \in \R Φ(x)+Φ(−x)=1,x∈R

  • μ\muμ 变大，PDF 向右移。σ\sigmaσ 变大，PDF 变平坦。

Transformation

For a discrete r.v. XXX with PMF pX(x)p_X(x)pX​(x):

pY(y)=P(Y=y)=∑x:g(x)=ypX(x)p_Y(y) = P(Y = y) = \sum_{x: g(x) = y} p_X(x) pY​(y)=P(Y=y)=x:g(x)=y∑​pX​(x)

E(Y)=E(g(X))=∑xg(x)pX(x)E(Y) = E(g(X)) = \sum_{x} g(x) p_X(x) E(Y)=E(g(X))=x∑​g(x)pX​(x)

For a continuous r.v. XXX with PDF fX(x)f_X(x)fX​(x):

pY(y)=P(Y=y)=∫x:g(x)=yfX(x)dxp_Y(y) = P(Y = y) = \int_{x: g(x) = y} f_X(x) \mathrm{d}x pY​(y)=P(Y=y)=∫x:g(x)=y​fX​(x)dx

fY(y)={∣h′(y)∣⋅fX(h(y)),where y is defined0,otherwisef_Y(y) = \begin{cases} |h'(y)| \cdot f_X(h(y)), & \text{where }y\text{ is defined} \\ 0, & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} fY​(y)={∣h′(y)∣⋅fX​(h(y)),0,​where y is definedotherwise​

E(Y)=E(g(X))=∫−∞∞g(x)f(x)dxE(Y) = E(g(X)) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} g(x) f(x) \mathrm{d}x E(Y)=E(g(X))=∫−∞∞​g(x)f(x)dx

  • where h(y)=g−1(y)h(y) = g^{-1}(y)h(y)=g−1(y)​ and it’s continuously-differentiable.

Jensen’s Inequality (琴生不等式):

  • For any convex function (凸函数):

    E(g(X))≥g(E(X))E(g(X)) \ge g(E(X)) E(g(X))≥g(E(X))

    For any concave fuction (凹函数):

    E(g(X))≤g(E(X))E(g(X)) \le g(E(X)) E(g(X))≤g(E(X))

  • Inferences:

    • E(∣X∣)≥∣E(X)∣E(|X|) \ge |E(X)|E(∣X∣)≥∣E(X)∣.
    • E(X2)≥(E(X))2E\left(X^2\right) \ge (E(X))^2E(X2)≥(E(X))2.
    • E(∣X∣p)≥∣E(X)∣pE\left({|X|}^p\right) \ge {|E(X)|}^pE(∣X∣p)≥∣E(X)∣p.
    • E(ecX)≥ecE(X)E\left(e^{cX}\right) \ge e^{cE(X)}E(ecX)≥ecE(X).

Chapter 3. Joint Distributions

Random Vector

A random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y)​ is also called a two-dimensional random variable.

For discrete random vectors: (Non-negativity, Normalization)

  • Joint CDF (联合累积分布函数): F(x,y)=P(X≤x,Y≤y)F(x, y) = P(X \le x, Y \le y)F(x,y)=P(X≤x,Y≤y), ∀x,y∈R\forall x, y \in \R∀x,y∈R.

    Marginal CDF (边缘累积分布函数): FX(x)=F(x,∞)F_X(x) = F(x, \infty)FX​(x)=F(x,∞), FY(y)=F(∞,y)F_Y(y) = F(\infty, y)FY​(y)=F(∞,y).

  • Joint PMF (联合概率质量函数): p(xi,yi)=P(X=xi,Y=yi)=pijp(x_i, y_i) = P(X = x_i, Y = y_i) = p_{ij}p(xi​,yi​)=P(X=xi​,Y=yi​)=pij​, i,j=1,2,⋯i, j = 1, 2, \cdotsi,j=1,2,⋯.

    Marginal PMF (边缘概率质量函数): pX(xi)=P(X=xi)=∑j=1∞pij=pip_X(x_i) = P(X = x_i) = \sum_{j = 1}^{\infty} p_{ij} = p_ipX​(xi​)=P(X=xi​)=∑j=1∞​pij​=pi​, i=1,2,⋯i = 1, 2, \cdotsi=1,2,⋯.

For continous random vectors: (Non-negativity, Normalization)

  • Joint CDF (联合累积分布函数): F(x,y)=∫−∞x∫−∞yf(u,v)dudvF(x, y) = \int_{-\infty}^{x}\int_{-\infty}^{y} f(u, v) \mathrm{d}u \mathrm{d}vF(x,y)=∫−∞x​∫−∞y​f(u,v)dudv, so that f(x,y)=∂2∂x∂yF(x,y)f(x, y) = \frac{\partial^2}{\partial x \partial y} F(x, y)f(x,y)=∂x∂y∂2​F(x,y).

  • Joint PDF (联合概率密度函数): P((X,Y)∈D)=∬(x,y)∈Df(x,y)dxdyP\big((X, Y) \in D\big) = \iint_{(x, y) \in D} f(x, y) \mathrm{d}x\mathrm{d}yP((X,Y)∈D)=∬(x,y)∈D​f(x,y)dxdy.

    Marginal PDF (边缘概率密度函数): fX(x)=∫−∞∞f(x,y)dyf_X(x) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(x, y) \mathrm{d}yfX​(x)=∫−∞∞​f(x,y)dy.

Conditinally: (Non-negativity, Normalization)

  • Conditional PMF (条件概率质量函数): pX∣Y(x∣y)=P(X=x∣Y=y)=p(x,y)pY(y)p_{X \mid Y}(x \mid y) = P(X = x \mid Y = y) = \frac{p(x, y)}{p_Y(y)}pX∣Y​(x∣y)=P(X=x∣Y=y)=pY​(y)p(x,y)​​. (pY(y)>0p_Y(y) > 0pY​(y)>0)

    Conditional PDF (条件概率密度函数): fX∣Y(x∣y)=f(x,y)fY(y)f_{X \mid Y}(x \mid y) = \frac{f(x, y)}{f_Y(y)}fX∣Y​(x∣y)=fY​(y)f(x,y)​​. (fY(y)>0f_Y(y) > 0fY​(y)>0)

Relationship

Independence of Random Variables:

  • Let F(x1,x2,…,xn)F(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n)F(x1​,x2​,…,xn​) be the joint CDF of (X1,X2,…,Xn)(X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​), FXi(xi)F_{X_i}(x_i)FXi​​(xi​) be the marginal CDF of XiX_iXi​, then if for ∀x1,x2,…,xn∈R\forall x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n \in \mathbb{R}∀x1​,x2​,…,xn​∈R we have

    F(x1,x2,…,xn)=FX1(x1)FX2(x2)…FXn(xn)F(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n) = F_{X_1}(x_1) F_{X_2}(x_2) \dots F_{X_n}(x_n) F(x1​,x2​,…,xn​)=FX1​​(x1​)FX2​​(x2​)…FXn​​(xn​)

    then they are (mutally) independent.

    For discrete random variables X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​, if they are independent, then the PMF satisfies

    p(x1,x2,…,xn)=P(X1=x1,…,Xn=xn)=pX1(x1)pX2(x2)…pXn(xn)p(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n) = P(X_1 = x_1, \dots, X_n = x_n) = p_{X_1}(x_1) p_{X_2}(x_2) \dots p_{X_n}(x_n) p(x1​,x2​,…,xn​)=P(X1​=x1​,…,Xn​=xn​)=pX1​​(x1​)pX2​​(x2​)…pXn​​(xn​)

    For continuous random variables X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​, if they are independent, then the PDF satisfies

    f(x1,x2,…,xn)=fX1(x1)fX2(x2)…fXn(xn)f(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n) = f_{X_1}(x_1) f_{X_2}(x_2) \dots f_{X_n}(x_n) f(x1​,x2​,…,xn​)=fX1​​(x1​)fX2​​(x2​)…fXn​​(xn​)

  • If XXX and YYY are independent random variables, then for any functions ggg and hhh, we have

    E[g(X)h(Y)]=E[g(X)]E[h(Y)],E[g(X)h(Y)] = E[g(X)]E[h(Y)], E[g(X)h(Y)]=E[g(X)]E[h(Y)],

    Var[g(X)±h(Y)]=Var[g(X)]+Var[h(Y)].(注意符号)\mathrm{Var}[g(X) \pm h(Y)] = \mathrm{Var}[g(X)] + \mathrm{Var}[h(Y)]. \quad (\text{注意符号}) Var[g(X)±h(Y)]=Var[g(X)]+Var[h(Y)].(注意符号)

Covariance (协方差):

  • The covariance between XXX and YYY, denoted by Cov(X,Y)\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y)Cov(X,Y), is defined by

    Cov(X,Y)=E[(X−E(X))(Y−E(Y))]=E(XY)−E(X)E(Y).\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y) = E[(X - E(X))(Y - E(Y))] = E(XY) - E(X)E(Y). Cov(X,Y)=E[(X−E(X))(Y−E(Y))]=E(XY)−E(X)E(Y).

    If XXX and YYY are independent, then Cov(X,Y)=0\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y) = 0Cov(X,Y)=0.

    However, if Cov(X,Y)=0\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y) = 0Cov(X,Y)=0, XXX and YYY may not be independent; we can only say that XXX and YYY are uncorrelated (不相关的).

  • Note that Cov(X,Y)>0\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y) > 0Cov(X,Y)>0 when XXX and YYY tend to vary in the same direction and <0< 0<0 when they tend to vary in the opposite direction.

  • Properties (a,b,ca, b, ca,b,c are constants):

    • Covariance-variance relationship:

      Cov(X,X)=Var(X);\mathrm{Cov}(X, X) = \mathrm{Var}(X); Cov(X,X)=Var(X);

      Var(X±Y)=Var(X)+Var(Y)±2Cov(X,Y).\mathrm{Var}(X \pm Y) = \mathrm{Var}(X) + \mathrm{Var}(Y) \pm 2\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y). Var(X±Y)=Var(X)+Var(Y)±2Cov(X,Y).

    • Symmetry:

      Cov(X,Y)=Cov(Y,X).\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y) = \mathrm{Cov}(Y, X). Cov(X,Y)=Cov(Y,X).

    • Constants cannot covary:

      Cov(X,c)=0.\mathrm{Cov}(X, c) = 0. Cov(X,c)=0.

    • Pulling out constants:

      Cov(aX,bY)=ab Cov(X,Y).\mathrm{Cov}(aX, bY) = ab\,\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y). Cov(aX,bY)=abCov(X,Y).

    • Distributive property:

      Cov(X1+X2,Y)=Cov(X1,Y)+Cov(X2,Y).\mathrm{Cov}(X_1 + X_2, Y) = \mathrm{Cov}(X_1, Y) + \mathrm{Cov}(X_2, Y). Cov(X1​+X2​,Y)=Cov(X1​,Y)+Cov(X2​,Y).

    • Bilinear property:

      Cov ⁣(∑i=1naiXi,  ∑j=1mbjYj)=∑i=1n∑j=1maibj Cov(Xi,Yj).\mathrm{Cov}\!\left(\sum_{i=1}^{n} a_i X_i,\; \sum_{j=1}^{m} b_j Y_j\right) = \sum_{i=1}^{n}\sum_{j=1}^{m} a_i b_j\,\mathrm{Cov}(X_i, Y_j). Cov(i=1∑n​ai​Xi​,j=1∑m​bj​Yj​)=i=1∑n​j=1∑m​ai​bj​Cov(Xi​,Yj​).

Correlation Coefficient (相关系数):

  • The correlation coefficient (相关系数) between XXX and YYY, denoted by Cor(X,Y)\mathrm{Cor}(X, Y)Cor(X,Y) or ρXY\rho_{XY}ρXY​, is defined by

    ρXY=Cor(X,Y)=Cov(X,Y)SD(X) SD(Y)=Cov(X,Y)Var(X)Var(Y).\rho_{XY} = \mathrm{Cor}(X, Y) = \frac{\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y)}{\mathrm{SD}(X)\,\mathrm{SD}(Y)} = \frac{\mathrm{Cov}(X, Y)}{\sqrt{\mathrm{Var}(X)\mathrm{Var}(Y)}}. ρXY​=Cor(X,Y)=SD(X)SD(Y)Cov(X,Y)​=Var(X)Var(Y)​Cov(X,Y)​.

    ρXY\rho_{XY}ρXY​​ is a normalized version of the covariance, which is a dimensionless quantity (无量纲数值).

  • ρXY∈[−1,1]\rho_{XY} \in [-1, 1]ρXY​∈[−1,1], measure the direction and strength of the linear relationship between XXX and YYY.

Conditional Expectation (条件期望):

  • For a discrete random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y), the conditional expectation of XXX given Y=yY = yY=y is

    E(X∣Y=y)=∑kxk⋅P(X=xk∣Y=y).E(X \mid Y = y) = \sum_k x_k \cdot P(X = x_k \mid Y = y). E(X∣Y=y)=k∑​xk​⋅P(X=xk​∣Y=y).

    For a continuous random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y), the conditional expectation of XXX given Y=yY = yY=y is

    E(X∣Y=y)=∫−∞∞x⋅fX∣Y(x∣y) dx,E(X \mid Y = y) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} x \cdot f_{X \mid Y}(x \mid y)\,dx, E(X∣Y=y)=∫−∞∞​x⋅fX∣Y​(x∣y)dx,

    where fX∣Y(x∣y)f_{X \mid Y}(x \mid y)fX∣Y​(x∣y) is the conditional PDF of XXX given Y=yY = yY=y.

Law of Total Expectation (全期望公式):

  • For a random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y), if E(X)E(X)E(X) exists, then

    E(X)=E ⁣(E(X∣Y)),E(X) = E\!\bigl(E(X \mid Y)\bigr), E(X)=E(E(X∣Y)),

    called double expectation.

  • Specifically,

    • For a discrete random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y),

      E(X)=∑jE(X∣Y=yj)⋅P(Y=yj).E(X) = \sum_j E(X \mid Y = y_j) \cdot P(Y = y_j). E(X)=j∑​E(X∣Y=yj​)⋅P(Y=yj​).

    • For a continuous random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y),

      E(X)=∫−∞∞E(X∣Y=y) fY(y) dy.E(X) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} E(X \mid Y = y)\,f_Y(y)\,dy. E(X)=∫−∞∞​E(X∣Y=y)fY​(y)dy.

Function of Multiple Random Variables

PDF of Z=X+YZ = X + YZ=X+Y - Continous Case:

  • Let f(x,y)f(x, y)f(x,y) be the PDF of random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y), then the PDF of Z=X+YZ = X + YZ=X+Y is

    fZ(z)=∫−∞∞f(z−y,y)dy=∫−∞∞f(x,z−x)dxf_Z(z) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(z - y, y) \mathrm{d}y = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f(x, z - x) \mathrm{d}x fZ​(z)=∫−∞∞​f(z−y,y)dy=∫−∞∞​f(x,z−x)dx

  • Specifically, if XXX and YYY are independent, then

    fZ(z)=fX∗fY≜∫−∞∞fX(z−y)fY(y)dy=∫−∞∞fX(x)fY(z−x)dxf_Z(z) = f_X * f_Y \triangleq \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f_X(z - y) f_Y(y) \mathrm{d}y = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} f_X(x) f_Y(z - x) \mathrm{d}x fZ​(z)=fX​∗fY​≜∫−∞∞​fX​(z−y)fY​(y)dy=∫−∞∞​fX​(x)fY​(z−x)dx

    where the two integrals are called the Convolution (卷积) of fXf_XfX​ and fYf_YfY​, denoted as fX∗fYf_X * f_YfX​∗fY​.

  • Sum of Independent Normal r.v.: If X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​ are independent and Xi∼N(μi,σi2)X_i \sim N(\mu_i, \sigma_i^2)Xi​∼N(μi​,σi2​), then for constants a1,a2,…,ana_1, a_2, \dots, a_na1​,a2​,…,an​,

    ∑i=1naiXi∼N(∑i=1naiμi,∑i=1naiσi2)\sum_{i = 1}^n a_i X_i \sim N\left(\sum_{i = 1}^n a_i \mu_i, \sum_{i = 1}^n a_i \sigma_i^2\right) i=1∑n​ai​Xi​∼N(i=1∑n​ai​μi​,i=1∑n​ai​σi2​)

PDF of Z=X+YZ = X + YZ=X+Y - Discrete Case:

  • Let XXX and YYY be two discrete r.v. ∈{0,1,2,… }\in \{0, 1, 2, \dots\}∈{0,1,2,…}, then the PMF of Z=X+YZ = X + YZ=X+Y is

    P(Z=k)=∑i=0kP(X=i,Y=k−i)=∑j=0kP(X=k−j,Y=j)P(Z = k) = \sum_{i = 0}^k P(X = i, Y = k - i) = \sum_{j = 0}^k P(X = k - j, Y = j) P(Z=k)=i=0∑k​P(X=i,Y=k−i)=j=0∑k​P(X=k−j,Y=j)

  • Spcifically, if XXX and YYY are independent, then

    P(Z=k)=∑i=0kP(X=i)⋅P(Y=k−i)=∑j=0kP(X=k−j)⋅P(Y=j)P(Z = k) = \sum_{i = 0}^k P(X = i) \cdot P(Y = k - i) = \sum_{j = 0}^k P(X = k - j) \cdot P(Y = j) P(Z=k)=i=0∑k​P(X=i)⋅P(Y=k−i)=j=0∑k​P(X=k−j)⋅P(Y=j)

    which is the Discrete Convolution Formula (离散卷积公式).

Central Limit Theorem (CLT, 中心极限定理):

  • For a sequence of i.i.d. (independent and identically distributed, 独立同分布) r.v. X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​ with μ≜E(Xi)\mu \triangleq E(X_i)μ≜E(Xi​) and σ2≜Var(Xi)\sigma^2 \triangleq \mathrm{Var}(X_i)σ2≜Var(Xi​), let Sn=∑XiS_n = \sum X_iSn​=∑Xi​ and Xˉn=Sn/n\bar X_n = S_n / nXˉn​=Sn​/n, then

    Zn=Sn−E(Sn)Var(Sn)=Sn−nμnσ2=n(Xˉn−μ)σZ_n = \frac{S_n - E(S_n)}{\sqrt{\mathrm{Var}(S_n)}} = \frac{S_n - n\mu}{\sqrt{n\sigma^2}} = \frac{\sqrt{n}(\bar X_n - \mu)}{\sigma} Zn​=Var(Sn​)​Sn​−E(Sn​)​=nσ2​Sn​−nμ​=σn​(Xˉn​−μ)​

  • As n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞, ZnZ_nZn​ converges in distribution (依分布收敛) to a standatd normal r.v., that is ∀z\forall z∀z,

    FZn(z)=P(Zn≤z)→n→∞Φ(z)F_{Z_n}(z) = P(Z_n \le z) \xrightarrow{n \to \infty} \Phi(z) FZn​​(z)=P(Zn​≤z)n→∞​Φ(z)

    If X1,X2,⋯XnX_1, X_2, \dotsm X_nX1​,X2​,⋯Xn​ are normal r.v.s, FZn(z)=P(Zn≤z)=Φ(z)F_{Z_n}(z) = P(Z_n \le z) = \Phi(z)FZn​​(z)=P(Zn​≤z)=Φ(z) even for small nnn.

  • The rule of thumb (经验法则): n≥30n \ge 30n≥30 should be to apply the CLT.

Approximation of Binomial(n,p)\text{Binomial}(n, p)Binomial(n,p):

  • Poisson Approximation Poisson(np)\text{Poisson}(np)Poisson(np): Works well when nnn is large and ppp is small, e.g., n>100n > 100n>100 and p<0.05p < 0.05p<0.05.
  • Normal Approximation N(np,np(1−p))N\big(np, np(1 - p)\big)N(np,np(1−p)): Works well when np≥5np \ge 5np≥5 and n(1−p)≥5n(1 - p) \ge 5n(1−p)≥5.
  • Continuity Correction (连续性修正): Expand the interval by 0.50.50.5 in each direction.

CDF of max⁡(X,Y)\max(X, Y)max(X,Y) & min⁡(X,Y)\min(X, Y)min(X,Y) - Continuous Case:

  • Let f(x,y)f(x, y)f(x,y) be the PDF of random vector (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y), then the CDFs of max⁡(X,Y)\max(X, Y)max(X,Y) and min⁡(X,Y)\min(X, Y)min(X,Y) are

    Fmax⁡(z)=∫−∞z∫−∞zf(x,y)dxdyF_{\max}(z) = \int_{-\infty}^{z} \int_{-\infty}^{z} f(x, y) \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y Fmax​(z)=∫−∞z​∫−∞z​f(x,y)dxdy

    Fmin⁡(z)=1−∫z∞∫z∞f(x,y)dxdyF_{\min}(z) = 1 - \int_{z}^{\infty} \int_{z}^{\infty} f(x, y) \mathrm{d}x \mathrm{d}y Fmin​(z)=1−∫z∞​∫z∞​f(x,y)dxdy

  • Specifically, if XXX and YYY are independent, then

    Fmax⁡(z)=FX(z)FY(z)F_{\max}(z) = F_X(z)F_Y(z) Fmax​(z)=FX​(z)FY​(z)

    Fmin⁡(z)=1−[1−FX(z)][1−FY(z)]F_{\min}(z) = 1 - [1 - F_X(z)][1 - F_Y(z)] Fmin​(z)=1−[1−FX​(z)][1−FY​(z)]

  • Generally, if X1,X2,...,Xn∼i.i.d.F(x)X_1, X_2, ..., X_n \overset{\text{i.i.d.}}{\sim} F(x)X1​,X2​,...,Xn​∼i.i.d.F(x) with PDF f(x)f(x)f(x), then the CDFs and PDFs of max⁡(X1,X2,...,Xn)\max(X_1, X_2, ..., X_n)max(X1​,X2​,...,Xn​) and min⁡(X1,X2,...,Xn)\min(X_1, X_2, ..., X_n)min(X1​,X2​,...,Xn​) are

    Fmax⁡(z)=[F(z)]n,fmax⁡(z)=nf(z)[F(z)]n−1F_{\max}(z) = [F(z)]^n, \quad f_{\max}(z) = n f(z)[F(z)]^{n-1} Fmax​(z)=[F(z)]n,fmax​(z)=nf(z)[F(z)]n−1

    Fmin⁡(z)=1−[1−F(z)]n,fmin⁡(z)=nf(z)[1−F(z)]n−1F_{\min}(z) = 1 - [1 - F(z)]^n, \quad f_{\min}(z) = n f(z)[1 - F(z)]^{n-1} Fmin​(z)=1−[1−F(z)]n,fmin​(z)=nf(z)[1−F(z)]n−1

Multivariate Normal Distribution

Bivariate Normal Distribution (二元正态分布):

  • Random vector (𝑋, 𝑌) is said to be bivariate normally distributed with means μX,μY\mu_X, \mu_YμX​,μY​ and variances σX2,σY2\sigma_X^2, \sigma_Y^2σX2​,σY2​, and with correlation coefficient ρ\rhoρ, then it can be expressed as

    (X,Y)∼N((uXμY)⋅(σX2ρσXσYρσXσYσY2))=N(μ,Σ)(X, Y) \sim N\left(\begin{pmatrix}u_X \\ \mu_Y\end{pmatrix} \cdot \begin{pmatrix} \sigma_X^2 & \rho \sigma_X \sigma_Y \\ \rho \sigma_X \sigma_Y & \sigma_Y^2 \end{pmatrix}\right) = N(\boldsymbol\mu, \boldsymbol\Sigma) (X,Y)∼N((uX​μY​​)⋅(σX2​ρσX​σY​​ρσX​σY​σY2​​))=N(μ,Σ)

    where μ\boldsymbol\muμ is the Mean Vector (均值向量) and Σ\boldsymbol\SigmaΣ is the Convariance Matrix (协方差矩阵).

  • Generally, for an nnn-dim random vector X=(X1,X2,…,Xn)⊤\boldsymbol X = (X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)^\topX=(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​)⊤:

    • The mean vector is E(X)≜(E(X1),E(X2),…,E(Xn))⊤E(\boldsymbol X) \triangleq \big(E(X_1), E(X_2), \dots, E(X_n)\big)^\topE(X)≜(E(X1​),E(X2​),…,E(Xn​))⊤.
    • The covariance matrix Cov(X)≜E[(X−E(X))(X−E(X))⊤]\mathrm{Cov}(\boldsymbol X) \triangleq E\Big[\big(\boldsymbol X - E(\boldsymbol X)\big) \big(\boldsymbol X - E(\boldsymbol X)\big)^\top\Big]Cov(X)≜E[(X−E(X))(X−E(X))⊤].

  • Properties:

    • Marginals: If (X,Y)(X, Y)(X,Y) is jointly normal, then the marginal distributions of XXX and YYY are univariate normal. 二元正态 -> 分别正态

    • Independence & Non-Correlation: For bivariate normal distribution, “Independent” is equal to “Uncorrelated (ρ=0\rho = 0ρ=0)”. 服从二元正态分布，则独立和不相关等价

    • Conditional Distributions: Y∣X=xY \mid X = xY∣X=x and X∣Y=yX \mid Y = yX∣Y=y​ is also normal.

      • Conditional Mean: E(Y∣X=x)=μY+ρσYσX(x−μX)E(Y \mid X = x) = \mu_Y + \rho \frac{\sigma_Y}{\sigma_X}(x - \mu_X)E(Y∣X=x)=μY​+ρσX​σY​​(x−μX​).
      • Conditional Variance: Var(Y∣X=x)=(1−ρ2)σY2\text{Var}(Y \mid X = x) = \left(1 - \rho^2\right)\sigma_Y^2Var(Y∣X=x)=(1−ρ2)σY2​​.

    • Linear Combinations: For any real matrix A=(a11a12a21a22)\boldsymbol A = \begin{pmatrix}a_{11} & a_{12} \\ a_{21} & a_{22}\end{pmatrix}A=(a11​a21​​a12​a22​​), then

      AX=(a11X+a12Ya21X+a22Y)∼N(Aμ,AΣAT)\boldsymbol{AX} = \begin{pmatrix} a_{11}X + a{12}Y \\ a_{21}X + a_{22}Y \end{pmatrix} \sim N(\boldsymbol{A\mu}, \boldsymbol{A\Sigma A^T}) AX=(a11​X+a12Ya21​X+a22​Y​)∼N(Aμ,AΣAT)

  • Application: Gaussian Mixture Model (GMM, ⾼斯混合模型).

Chapter 4. Monte Carlo Methods

Law of Large Numbers (LLN)

For a sequence of i.i.d. r.v.s X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​ with μ≜E(Xi)<∞\mu \triangleq E(X_i) < \inftyμ≜E(Xi​)<∞, Xˉn=(X1+X2+⋯+Xn)/n\bar X_n = (X_1 + X_2 + \dots + X_n) / nXˉn​=(X1​+X2​+⋯+Xn​)/n converges in probability (依概率收敛) to μ\muμ as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞:

Xˉn→Pμ, as n→∞\bar X_n \xrightarrow{P} \mu, \text{ as } n \to \infty Xˉn​P​μ, as n→∞

Simulation of Random Variables

Pseudo-Random Number Generator (PRNG):

  • Computers generate pseudo-random numbers, not truly random.
  • They are determined by an initial value called the seed.
  • Pros: Fast and Reproducible (same seed = same sequence).
  • The Building Block (U[0,1]U[0,1]U[0,1]):
    • PRNGs typically provide a sequence of independent uniformly distributed numbers on [0,1][0, 1][0,1].
    • Goal: Transform U∼U[0,1]U \sim U[0,1]U∼U[0,1] into other distributions (Bernoulli, Poisson, Normal, etc.).

Discrete Distributions:

  • Bernoulli (ppp): Generate uuu. If u<pu < pu<p, output 1; else output 0.
  • Poisson (λ\lambdaλ): Divide interval (0,1)(0,1)(0,1) into sub-intervals based on the PMF (probability mass function). Check which interval uuu falls into.

Inverse Transformation Sampling (逆变换采样):

  • Theory: If F(x)F(x)F(x) is the CDF, let U∼U[0,1]U \sim U[0,1]U∼U[0,1], then X=F−1(U)X = F^{-1}(U)X=F−1(U) follows the distribution FFF.
  • e.g. Exponential (λ\lambdaλ):
    • F(x)=1−e−λx→F−1(u)=−ln⁡(1−u)λF(x) = 1 - e^{-\lambda x} \rightarrow F^{-1}(u) = -\frac{\ln(1-u)}{\lambda}F(x)=1−e−λx→F−1(u)=−λln(1−u)​.
    • Since 1−u1-u1−u is also uniform, we can use x=−ln⁡(u)λx = -\frac{\ln(u)}{\lambda}x=−λln(u)​.

Rejection Sampling (拒绝采样):

  1. Concept:
    • Target Distribution: f(x)f(x)f(x) (The difficult one we want).
    • Proposal Distribution: g(x)g(x)g(x) (An easy one we can sample from, e.g., Uniform or Normal).
    • Condition: We need a constant c>1c > 1c>1 such that f(x)≤c⋅g(x)f(x) \le c \cdot g(x)f(x)≤c⋅g(x) for all xxx. (The curve cg(x)cg(x)cg(x) must cover f(x)f(x)f(x) completely).
  2. Algorithm:
    • Step 1: Generate a candidate xxx from g(x)g(x)g(x).
    • Step 2: Generate a random uuu from U[0,1]U[0,1]U[0,1].
    • Step 3: Accept xxx if u≤f(x)c⋅g(x)u \le \frac{f(x)}{c \cdot g(x)}u≤c⋅g(x)f(x)​. Otherwise, Reject and repeat.
  3. Rationale (Dartboard Analogy):
    • Throw darts uniformly at the area under c⋅g(x)c \cdot g(x)c⋅g(x).
    • Keep only the darts that fall under the curve f(x)f(x)f(x).
  4. Efficiency:
    • Acceptance probability = 1/c1/c1/c.
    • Ideally, ccc should be as small as possible (close to 1) to reduce waste (rejected samples).

Chapter 5. Basic Statistics

Basic Concepts

Population (总体): The entire set of individuals, objects, events, or measurements that share a common characteristic and are of interest in a particular study.

Parameter (参数): Any numerical characteristic of a population.

Sample (样本): A subset of the population, which is used to make inferences about the population.

  • nnn individuals are selected from the population, their quantitative index are recorded as X1,X2,…,XnX_1, X_2, \dots, X_nX1​,X2​,…,Xn​, which is called a sample of size nnn, nnn is the sample size (样本容量).
  • The process of selecting individuals from the population is called sampling (抽样).
  • The observed values x1,x2,…,xnx_1, x_2, \dots, x_nx1​,x2​,…,xn​ of X1,X2,⋯ ,XnX_1, X_2, \cdots, X_nX1​,X2​,⋯,Xn​ we obtained after sampling are called sample observed values (样本观测值).

Simple Random Sampling (简单随机抽样): To select samples in a completely random manner, ensuring that every individual in the population has an equal probability of being chosen.

Statisic (统计量):

  • If X1,...,XnX_1, ..., X_nX1​,...,Xn​ is a sample from population X∼f(x;θ)X \sim f(x; \boldsymbol{\theta})X∼f(x;θ) and g(x1,...,xn)g(x_1, ..., x_n)g(x1​,...,xn​) is an nnn-variate function (nnn 元函数). then T=g(X1,...,Xn)T = g(X_1, ..., X_n)T=g(X1​,...,Xn​) is called a statistic if g()g()g() does not involve any unknown parameter.

  • e.g. that commonly used:

    • Sample Mean (样本均值):

      Xˉ=1n∑i=1nXi\bar{X} = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} X_i Xˉ=n1​i=1∑n​Xi​

    • Sample Variance (样本方差) & Sample Standard Deviation (样本标准差):

      S2=1n−1∑i=1n(Xi−Xˉ)2,S=S2S^2 = \frac{1}{n-1} \sum_{i=1}^{n} (X_i - \bar{X})^2, \quad S = \sqrt{S^2} S2=n−11​i=1∑n​(Xi​−Xˉ)2,S=S2​

    • Order Statistics (顺序统计量):

      (X(1),X(2),...,X(n))(X_{(1)}, X_{(2)}, ..., X_{(n)}) (X(1)​,X(2)​,...,X(n)​)

      It implys that X(1)=min⁡{X1,...,Xn}X_{(1)} = \min\{X_1, ..., X_n\}X(1)​=min{X1​,...,Xn​}, $X_{(n)} = \max{X_1, …, X_n} $.

    • Sample ppp-Quantile (样本 ppp 分位数): number that exceeds at most 100p%100p\%100p% of the sample and is exceeded by at most 100(1−p)%100(1-p)\%100(1−p)% of the sample.

      Qp={X(⌊np+1⌋),if np is not an integer(X(np)+X(np+1))2,if np is an integerQ_p = \begin{cases} X_{(\lfloor np+1 \rfloor)}, & \text{if } np \text{ is not an integer} \\ \frac{(X_{(np)} + X_{(np+1)})}{2}, & \text{if } np \text{ is an integer} \end{cases} Qp​={X(⌊np+1⌋)​,2(X(np)​+X(np+1)​)​,​if np is not an integerif np is an integer​

      Specifically,

      • Q0.5Q_{0.5}Q0.5​ is the Sample Median (样本中位数).
      • Q0.25Q_{0.25}Q0.25​ (Q0.75Q_{0.75}Q0.75​) is the Sample Lower (Upper) Quartile (样本下(上)四分位数) or the Sample First (Third) Quartile (样本第一(三)四分位数) , also written as Q1Q_1Q1​ (Q3Q_3Q3​).
      • Q3−Q1Q_3 - Q_1Q3​−Q1​ is the Sample Interquartile Range (Sample IQR, 样本四分位距).

Sampling Distribution: The distribution of a statistic.

Point Estimation

Point Estimation: Estimating an unknown parameter with a statistic.

  • Estimator (估计量): A statistic θ^l(X1,X2,…,Xn)\hat\theta_l(X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)θ^l​(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​) (an nnn-variate function), used to estimate θl\theta_lθl​.
  • Estimate / Estimated Value (估计值): θ^l(x1,x2,…,xn)\hat\theta_l(x_1, x_2, \dots, x_n)θ^l​(x1​,x2​,…,xn​)​​.
  • Parameter Space (参数空间) Θ\boldsymbol \ThetaΘ: The set of values that θ=(θ1,...,θk)\boldsymbol\theta = (\theta_1, ..., \theta_k)θ=(θ1​,...,θk​) can take.

Unbiasedness (无偏性):

  • Unbiased Estimator (无偏估计量): If for ∀θ∈Θ\forall \boldsymbol\theta \in \boldsymbol\Theta∀θ∈Θ, we have

    Eθ(θ^l)=θlE_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_l) = \theta_l Eθ​(θ^l​)=θl​

    where Eθ(θ^l)E_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_l)Eθ​(θ^l​) is the expected value of the estimator θl\theta_lθl​, assuming the true population parameter is θ\boldsymbol\thetaθ.

    Then θ^l\hat\theta_lθ^l​ is called an unbiased estimator of θl\theta_lθl​. Otherwise, it is called a biased estimator of θl\theta_lθl​.

  • Bias: Eθ(θ^l)−θlE_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_l) - \theta_lEθ​(θ^l​)−θl​.

  • Asymptotic Unbiased Estimator (渐进无偏估计量): The bias is not 000 but converge to 000 as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞.

  • μ^=Xˉ\hat{\mu} = \bar{X}μ^​=Xˉ and σ^2=S2\hat{\sigma}^2 = S^2σ^2=S2 are unbiased estimators of μ\muμ and σ2\sigma^2σ2, if the population mean μ=E(X)\mu = E(X)μ=E(X) and population variance σ2=Var(X)\sigma^2 = \mathrm{Var}(X)σ2=Var(X)​ exist.

要求给出的估计量 θ^\hat\thetaθ^ 的期望，利用期望的性质将其转化为 E(X)E(X)E(X) 等可以用 θ\thetaθ 表示的式子并化简。

Relative Efficiency (相对有效性):

  • For two unbiased estimators θ^l1\hat\theta_{l1}θ^l1​ and θ^l2\hat\theta_{l2}θ^l2​ of θl\theta_lθl​, if for ∀θ∈Θ\forall \boldsymbol{\theta} \in \mathbf{\Theta}∀θ∈Θ, we have

    Varθ(θ^l1)≤Varθ(θ^l2)\mathrm{Var}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_{l1}) \leq \mathrm{Var}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_{l2}) Varθ​(θ^l1​)≤Varθ​(θ^l2​)

    and Varθ(θ^l1)<Varθ(θ^l2)\mathrm{Var}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_{l1}) < \mathrm{Var}_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(\hat{\theta}_{l2})Varθ​(θ^l1​)<Varθ​(θ^l2​) for at least one θ\boldsymbol{\theta}θ, then θ^l1\hat{\theta}_{l1}θ^l1​ is said to be more efficient (更有效) than θ^l2\hat{\theta}_{l2}θ^l2​​.

求方差，利用方差的性质不断代入化简：

Var(g(X)±h(Y))=Var(g(X))+Var(h(Y))\mathrm{Var}(g(X) \pm h(Y)) = \mathrm{Var}(g(X)) + \mathrm{Var}(h(Y)) Var(g(X)±h(Y))=Var(g(X))+Var(h(Y))

Var(aX+b)=a2Var(X)\mathrm{Var}(aX + b) = a^2 \mathrm{Var}(X) Var(aX+b)=a2Var(X)

Consistency (相合性):

  • If for ∀θ∈Θ\forall \boldsymbol{\theta} \in \mathbf{\Theta}∀θ∈Θ and ∀ϵ>0\forall \epsilon > 0∀ϵ>0, we have

    lim⁡n→∞Pθ(∣θ^l−θl∣>ϵ)=0\lim_{n \to \infty} P_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(|\hat{\theta}_l - \theta_l| > \epsilon) = 0 n→∞lim​Pθ​(∣θ^l​−θl​∣>ϵ)=0

  • If θ^\hat\thetaθ^ is an asymptotic unbiased estimator of θ\thetaθ and Var(θ^)→0\mathrm{Var}(\hat\theta) \to 0Var(θ^)→0 as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞, then θ^\hat\thetaθ^ is a consistent estimator of θ\thetaθ​. 渐进无偏 + 方差收敛到 0 -> 相合

Chebyshev’s Inequuality (切比雪夫不等式):

  • Let XXX be a r.v. with mean μ=E(X)\mu = E(X)μ=E(X) and variance σ2=Var(X)\sigma^2 = \mathrm{Var}(X)σ2=Var(X) both exists, then

    P(∣X−μ∣≥kσ)≤1k2P(|X - \mu| \ge k\sigma) \le \frac{1}{k^2} P(∣X−μ∣≥kσ)≤k21​

Method of Moments

The kkk-th Population Moment (总体 kkk 阶矩): μk=E(Xk)\mu_k = E\left(X^k\right)μk​=E(Xk)​​.

The kkk-th Population Central Moment (总体 kkk 阶中心矩): μ~k=E[(X−μ1)k]\tilde{\mu}_k = E\left[(X - \mu_1)^k\right]μ~​k​=E[(X−μ1​)k]. (k≥2k \ge 2k≥2)

  • μ1=E(X)\mu_1 = E(X)μ1​=E(X), μ~2=Var(X)\tilde\mu_2 = \mathrm{Var}(X)μ~​2​=Var(X).

The kkk-th Sample Moment (样本 kkk 阶矩): Mk=1n∑i=1nXikM_k = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} X_i^kMk​=n1​∑i=1n​Xik​.

The kkk-th Sample Central Moment (样本 kkk 阶中心矩): M~k=1n∑i=1n(Xi−Xˉ)k\tilde{M}_k = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i=1}^{n} (X_i - \bar{X})^kM~k​=n1​∑i=1n​(Xi​−Xˉ)k. (k≥2k \ge 2k≥2)

  • M1=XˉM_1 = \bar XM1​=Xˉ, M~2=S~2=(n−1)S2/n\tilde M_2 = \tilde S^2 = (n - 1) S^2 / nM~2​=S~2=(n−1)S2/n.
  • Actually, M~2=M2−M12\tilde{M}_2 = M_2 - M_1^2M~2​=M2​−M12​. (just like Var(X)=E(X2)−[E(X)]2\text{Var}(X) = E\left(X^2\right) - [E(X)]^2Var(X)=E(X2)−[E(X)]2)

Method of Moments (矩估计法):

If we have kkk unknown parameters (θ1,…,θk)(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k)(θ1​,…,θk​):

  1. Calculate Theoretical Moments: Express μ1,μ2,...\mu_1, \mu_2, ...μ1​,μ2​,... as functions of (θ1,…,θk)(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k)(θ1​,…,θk​).

    μ1(θ1,…,θk),μ2(θ1,…,θk),…\mu_1(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k), \mu_2(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k), \dots μ1​(θ1​,…,θk​),μ2​(θ1​,…,θk​),…

  2. Set up Equations: Equate population moments to sample moments.

    {μ1(θ1,…,θk)=M1μ2(θ1,…,θk)=M2…\begin{cases} \mu_1(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k) = M_1 \\ \mu_2(\theta_1, \dots, \theta_k) = M_2 \\ \dots \end{cases} ⎩⎪⎪⎨⎪⎪⎧​μ1​(θ1​,…,θk​)=M1​μ2​(θ1​,…,θk​)=M2​…​

  3. Solve for θ\boldsymbol\thetaθ: The solutions θ^1,…,θ^k\hat{\theta}_1, \dots, \hat{\theta}_kθ^1​,…,θ^k​​ are called the Moment Estimators (矩估计量).

有多少参数求多少阶矩。以两个参数为例，求出 μ1=E(X)\mu_1 = E(X)μ1​=E(X)、μ2=E(X2)\mu_2 = E\left(X^2\right)μ2​=E(X2) 用参数 θ1,θ2\theta_1, \theta_2θ1​,θ2​ 表示的结果，形成方程组：

{E(X)=M1E(X2)=M2\begin{cases} E(X) = M_1 \\ E\left(X^2\right) = M_2 \end{cases} {E(X)=M1​E(X2)=M2​​

把 M1,M2M_1, M_2M1​,M2​ 当作已知数解出 θ^1,θ^2\hat\theta_1, \hat\theta_2θ^1​,θ^2​，再代入（或者说明）：

M1=1n∑i=1nXi,M2=1n∑i=1nXi2M_1 = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i = 1}^n X_i, \quad M_2 = \frac{1}{n} \sum_{i = 1}^n X_i^2 M1​=n1​i=1∑n​Xi​,M2​=n1​i=1∑n​Xi2​

即可。

  • For Mean and Variance (in Any Distribution):

    • Estimator for Population Mean μ\muμ:

      μ^=M1=Xˉ\hat{\mu} = M_1 = \bar{X} μ^​=M1​=Xˉ

    • Estimator for Population Variance σ2\sigma^2σ2:

      σ^2=M~2=S~2=n−1nS2=1n∑i=1n(Xi−Xˉ)2\hat{\sigma}^2 = \tilde M_2 = \tilde S^2 = \frac{n - 1}{n} S^2 = \frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n (X_i - \bar{X})^2 σ^2=M~2​=S~2=nn−1​S2=n1​i=1∑n​(Xi​−Xˉ)2

      Note: This is the biased variance (dividing by nnn, but it’s consistent), not the unbiased sample variance S2S^2S2.

  • The moment estimator of a parameter may not be unique.

Method of Maximum Likelihood

Likelihood Function (似然函数) L\mathcal{L}L:

  • Since the sample variables X1,...,XnX_1, ..., X_nX1​,...,Xn​ are i.i.d., the joint probability is the product of individual densities/probabilities:

    L(θ;x1,...,xn)=∏i=1nf(xi;θ)\mathcal{L}(\boldsymbol\theta; x_1, ..., x_n) = \prod_{i=1}^{n} f(x_i; \boldsymbol\theta) L(θ;x1​,...,xn​)=i=1∏n​f(xi​;θ)

  • If there exists θ^=θ^(x1,…,xn)\hat{\boldsymbol{\theta}} = \hat{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(x_1, \dots, x_n)θ^=θ^(x1​,…,xn​) such that

    L(θ^)=max⁡θ∈ΘL(θ;x1,…,xn),\mathcal{L}(\hat{\boldsymbol{\theta}}) = \max_{\boldsymbol{\theta} \in \boldsymbol{\Theta}} \mathcal{L}(\boldsymbol{\theta}; x_1, \dots, x_n), L(θ^)=θ∈Θmax​L(θ;x1​,…,xn​),

    then θ^(x1,…,xn)\hat{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(x_1, \dots, x_n)θ^(x1​,…,xn​) is the Maximum Likelihood Estimate (极大似然估计值) of θ\boldsymbol{\theta}θ, the corresponding estimator θ^(X1,…,Xn)\hat{\boldsymbol{\theta}}(X_1, \dots, X_n)θ^(X1​,…,Xn​) is the Maximum Likelihood Estimator (MLE, 极大似然估计量) of θ\boldsymbol{\theta}θ.

Log-Likelihood Function (对数似然函数) ℓ\ellℓ:

  • Maximizing L(θ;x)\mathcal{L}(\boldsymbol\theta; \boldsymbol{x})L(θ;x) is equivalent to maximizing the log-likelihood function:

    ℓ(θ;x)=log⁡L(θ;x)=∑i=1nlog⁡f(xi;θ)\ell(\boldsymbol\theta; \boldsymbol{x}) = \log \mathcal{L}(\boldsymbol\theta; \boldsymbol{x}) = \sum_{i=1}^{n} \log f(x_i; \boldsymbol\theta) ℓ(θ;x)=logL(θ;x)=i=1∑n​logf(xi​;θ)

Method of Maximum Likelihood:

  1. Write the Likelihood Function:

    L(θ)=∏i=1nf(xi;θ)\mathcal{L}(\theta) = \prod_{i=1}^n f(x_i; \theta) L(θ)=i=1∏n​f(xi​;θ)

  2. Take the Logarithm:

    ℓ(θ)=ln⁡L(θ)=∑i=1nln⁡f(xi;θ)\ell(\theta) = \ln \mathcal{L}(\theta) = \sum_{i=1}^n \ln f(x_i; \theta) ℓ(θ)=lnL(θ)=i=1∑n​lnf(xi​;θ)

  3. Differentiate: Take the derivative with respect to θ\thetaθ and set it to 000 to find the critical point.

    ddθℓ(θ)=0\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}\theta} \ell(\theta) = 0 dθd​ℓ(θ)=0

  4. Solve for θ\thetaθ: The solution is the MLE, denoted as θ^\hat{\theta}θ^.

    (Check second derivative <0< 0<0​​ to ensure it is a maximum, though usually assumed in exams.)

对于连续 r.v.，求出 PDF 后，把 ∑ln⁡Xi\sum \ln X_i∑lnXi​ 当作已知数。对 ℓ(θ)\ell(\theta)ℓ(θ) 求导 =0= 0=0 解出 θ^\hat\thetaθ^ 后，可以验证一下二阶导正负。

Summary:

  • Under mild regularity conditions, the moment estimators and maximum likelihood estimators are consistent and asymptotic unbiased estimators.
  • Asymptotic Normality: Under mild regularity conditions, for large samples, a maximum likelihood estimator has an approximately normal distribution.

Interval Estimation

Confidence Interval (置信区间):

  • For ∀α∈(0,1)\forall \alpha \in (0, 1)∀α∈(0,1), if for ∀θ∈Θ\forall \boldsymbol{\theta} \in \boldsymbol{\Theta}∀θ∈Θ, there exists two statistics θ^l1(X1,...,Xn)\hat{\theta}_{l1}(X_1, ..., X_n)θ^l1​(X1​,...,Xn​) and θ^l2(X1,...,Xn)\hat{\theta}_{l2}(X_1, ..., X_n)θ^l2​(X1​,...,Xn​) such that

    Pθ(θ^l1<θl<θ^l2)≥1−αP_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\left(\hat{\theta}_{l1} < \theta_l < \hat{\theta}_{l2}\right) \ge 1 - \alpha Pθ​(θ^l1​<θl​<θ^l2​)≥1−α

    then (θ^l1,θ^l2)(\hat{\theta}_{l1}, \hat{\theta}_{l2})(θ^l1​,θ^l2​) is called a Confidence Interval of θl\theta_lθl​ with Confidence Level (置信水平) 1−α1 - \alpha1−α, or simply a 100(1−α)%100(1 - \alpha)\%100(1−α)% confidence interval. θ^l1\hat{\theta}_{l1}θ^l1​ and θ^l2\hat{\theta}_{l2}θ^l2​ are called the Confidence Lower Limit (置信下限) and Confidence Upper Limit (置信上限), respectively.

General Method: 置信区间=点估计±(系数×标准误差)\text{置信区间} = \text{点估计} \pm (\text{系数} \times \text{标准误差})置信区间=点估计±(系数×标准误差).

  • For a consistent estimator θ^l(X1,X2,…,Xn)\hat\theta_l(X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)θ^l​(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​) of θl\theta_lθl​ with the Standard Error (标准误) σ(θ^l)=SD(θ^l)\sigma(\hat\theta_l) = \mathrm{SD}(\hat\theta_l)σ(θ^l​)=SD(θ^l​):

    • If θ^l\hat{\theta}_lθ^l​ exactly follows a normal distribution N(θl,σ2(θ^l))N\big(\theta_l, \sigma^2(\hat\theta_l)\big)N(θl​,σ2(θ^l​)), and σ2(θ^l)\sigma^2(\hat\theta_l)σ2(θ^l​) is known, then an exact 100(1−α)%100(1 - \alpha)\%100(1−α)% confidence interval of θl\theta_lθl​ is

      θ^l±zα/2σ(θ^l)=(θ^l−zα/2σ(θ^l),θ^l+zα/2σ(θ^l))\hat{\theta}_l \pm z_{\alpha/2}\sigma(\hat{\theta}_l) = \left(\hat{\theta}_l - z_{\alpha/2}\sigma(\hat{\theta}_l), \hat{\theta}_l + z_{\alpha/2}\sigma(\hat{\theta}_l)\right) θ^l​±zα/2​σ(θ^l​)=(θ^l​−zα/2​σ(θ^l​),θ^l​+zα/2​σ(θ^l​))

    • If θ^l\hat{\theta}_lθ^l​ approximately follows a normal distribution N(θl,σ2(θ^l))N\big(\theta_l, \sigma^2(\hat\theta_l)\big)N(θl​,σ2(θ^l​)) (due to CLT as n→∞n \to \inftyn→∞), or the true variance is unknown and replaced by a consistent estimator σ^2(θ^l)\hat{\sigma}^2(\hat{\theta}_l)σ^2(θ^l​), then a large sample 100(1−α)%100(1 - \alpha)\%100(1−α)% confidence interval of θl\theta_lθl​ is

      θ^l±zα/2σ^(θ^l)=(θ^l−zα/2σ^(θ^l),θ^l+zα/2σ^(θ^l))\hat{\theta}_l \pm z_{\alpha/2}\hat{\sigma}(\hat{\theta}_l) = \left(\hat{\theta}_l - z_{\alpha/2}\hat{\sigma}(\hat{\theta}_l), \hat{\theta}_l + z_{\alpha/2}\hat{\sigma}(\hat{\theta}_l)\right) θ^l​±zα/2​σ^(θ^l​)=(θ^l​−zα/2​σ^(θ^l​),θ^l​+zα/2​σ^(θ^l​))

  • Commonly used values: z0.10=1.282z_{0.10} = 1.282z0.10​=1.282, z0.05=1.645z_{0.05} = 1.645z0.05​=1.645, z0.025=1.960z_{0.025} = 1.960z0.025​=1.960, z0.01=2.326z_{0.01} = 2.326z0.01​=2.326, z0.005=2.576z_{0.005} = 2.576z0.005​=2.576.

Chapter 6. Hypothesis Testing

Basic Ideas

Hypothesis:

  • Null Hypothesis (零假设/原假设) H0H_0H0​: The default assumption, status quo, no effect, or “innocent”. We assume it is true until evidence proves otherwise.
  • Alternative Hypothesis (备择假设) H1H_1H1​: The claim the researcher wants to prove.
    • H0H_0H0​ and H1H_1H1​ are simply two mutually exclusive statements.
  • Proof by Contradiction: We try to find sufficient evidence to reject H0H_0H0​​.

Test Statistic:

  • A value calculated and standardized from sample data, usually obtained by a suitable transformation of its estimator θ^\hat\thetaθ^.

Rejection Region (RR, 拒绝域):

  • The set of samples X=(X1,X2,…,Xn)\boldsymbol X = (X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)X=(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​) such that Xˉ−8>c\bar X - 8 > cXˉ−8>c, denoted by {X:Xˉ−8>c}\{\boldsymbol X: \bar X - 8 > c\}{X:Xˉ−8>c}.

2 Types of Errors:

  • Type I Error: Reject H0H_0H0​ when it is actually true. 冤枉好人
    • Type I Error Rate: P(X∈RR∣H0 is true)P(X \in \mathrm{RR} \mid H_0 \text{ is true})P(X∈RR∣H0​ is true).
  • Type II Error: Fail to reject H0H_0H0​ when it is not true. 放过坏人
    • Type II Error Rate: β=P(X∉RR∣H1 is true)\beta = P(X \not\in \mathrm{RR} \mid H_1 \text{ is true})β=P(X∈RR∣H1​ is true).
  • For a given sample size and form of the RR, we cannot reduce the two error rates at the same time.

Significance Test (显著性检验):

  • Let X=(X1,X2,…,Xn)\boldsymbol X = (X_1, X_2, \dots, X_n)X=(X1​,X2​,…,Xn​) be a simple random sample from the population X∼f(x;θ1,θ2,…,θk)X \sim f(x; \theta_1, \theta_2, \dots, \theta_k)X∼f(x;θ1​,θ2​,…,θk​). For testing problem H0:θl∈Θl0↔H1:θ1∈Θl1H_0: \theta_l \in \Theta_{l0} \leftrightarrow H_1: \theta_1 \in \Theta_{l1}H0​:θl​∈Θl0​↔H1​:θ1​∈Θl1​ and ∀α∈(0,1)\forall \alpha \in (0, 1)∀α∈(0,1)​, if a test has rejection region RR such that

    Pθ(X∈RR)≤α,∀θ∈Θ∧θl∈Θl0P_{\boldsymbol\theta}(\boldsymbol X \in \mathrm{RR}) \le \alpha, \quad \forall \boldsymbol\theta \in \boldsymbol\Theta \land \theta_l \in \Theta_{l0} Pθ​(X∈RR)≤α,∀θ∈Θ∧θl​∈Θl0​

    then the test is called a Significance Test of θl\theta_lθl​ with Significance Level (显著性水平) α\alphaα. α\alphaα is the upper bound of Type I Error Rate.

P-value:

  • The probability of obtaining results at least as extreme as the observed data, assuming H0H_0H0​ is true.
  • Given a significance level α\alphaα, we would reject H0H_0H0​ if p-value<αp\text{-value} < \alphap-value<α; otherwise, we fail to reject H0H_0H0​.

Statistical Power (统计功效):

  • The probability of correctly detecting an effect when it actually exists.

    Power=1−β=P(Reject H0∣H1 is true)\text{Power} = 1 - \beta = P(\text{Reject } H_0 \mid H_1 \text{ is true}) Power=1−β=P(Reject H0​∣H1​ is true)

  • Factors affecting Power:

    • Significance Level α\alphaα: Larger α\alphaα -> Smaller β\betaβ -> Higher Power.
    • Effect Size: Larger difference between the true parameter value and the values in H0H_0H0​ -> Higher Power.
    • Sample Size nnn: Larger nnn -> Smaller sampling error rate -> Higher Power.

Testing Process

4 Steps:

  1. Formulate Hypotheses: Set up H0H_0H0​ and H1H_1H1​ (One-sided or Two-sided).
  2. Test Statistic: Choose formula (usually Z-test for large samples).
  3. Decision Rule: Calculate P-value or check if Statistic falls in Rejection Region based on α\alphaα.
  4. Conclusion: Reject or Fail to reject.

3 Forms of Parametric Hypothesis Testing:

  • H0:θ=θ0↔H1:θ<θ0H_0: \theta = \theta_0 \leftrightarrow H_1: \theta < \theta_0H0​:θ=θ0​↔H1​:θ<θ0​, a one-sided, left-tail alternative hypothesis.
  • H0:θ=θ0↔H1:θ>θ0H_0: \theta = \theta_0 \leftrightarrow H_1: \theta > \theta_0H0​:θ=θ0​↔H1​:θ>θ0​, a one-sided, right-tail alternative hypothesis.
  • H0:θ=θ0↔H1:θ≠θ0H_0: \theta = \theta_0 \leftrightarrow H_1: \theta \neq \theta_0H0​:θ=θ0​↔H1​:θ=θ0​, a two-sided alternative hypothesis.

Common Test Types:

  • Mean Test (Z-test): Testing if population mean μ\muμ is greater/less/equal to a value.

    Z=Xˉ−μ0σ/nZ = \frac{\bar{X} - \mu_0}{\sigma / \sqrt{n}} Z=σ/n​Xˉ−μ0​​

  • Two-Sample Mean Difference: Testing if μ1=μ2\mu_1 = \mu_2μ1​=μ2​.

    Z=(Xˉ−Yˉ)−0σX2n+σY2mZ = \frac{(\bar{X} - \bar{Y}) - 0}{\sqrt{\frac{\sigma_X^2}{n} + \frac{\sigma_Y^2}{m}}} Z=nσX2​​+mσY2​​​(Xˉ−Yˉ)−0​

  • Proportion Test (Bernoulli): Testing defect rates or percentages (ppp).

    Z=p^−p0p0(1−p0)/nZ = \frac{\hat{p} - p_0}{\sqrt{p_0(1-p_0)/n}} Z=p0​(1−p0​)/n​p^​−p0​​

Summary

  • Confidence intervals and significance tests are similar in that they both rely on the distribution of an estimator of the parameter of interest.
  • Limitations:
    • Statistical Significance: The effect is not due to chance (P-value is small).
    • Practical Significance: The effect is large enough to matter in the real world.
    • With a huge sample size, even a tiny, meaningless difference can be “statistically significant.”
